Reviews.Title: “Best priced central London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smileboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend. Everything was perfect from checking in to checking out. Staff friendly nd smiling, room was clean, full English breakfast was served, and also free Internet access. I will suggest this to others nd will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in London.. always at a price!”
Reviews.Author: FailteEire
Reviews.Content: London hotels are over priced and therefore leave you with a sense of poor value for your money. This hotel is not different in that respect. However, the location is great and it is in a relatively quite street. The room I had was small, it had a stand alone fan that helped to cool the room and it created some "white noise" which helped with sleeping. On my sleep quality index I would rate it as an 7.5/10. A good breakfast was supplied. Staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: SalmonEllen
Reviews.Content: Most London hotel rooms, especially single rooms, are overpriced, overheated, undersized and noisy, and this one is no exception. However, the area is quiet and near shops and eateries, the room clean, the shower powerful, the bed comfortable, the window openable, a fan available, the free wifi dependable and the complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast good. The Hilton is twice as expensive, but not twice as good, so I think the Regency Hotel is great value for a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and standards”
Reviews.Author: TheLochNessMonster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on 27 and 28 June 2011. Booked through bookings.com and managed to get a decent rate of £176 for 2 nights including full english breakfast. I was travelling on my own so I had a single room which costs less than a double. The room was (or should that be is, I'm sat in it now typing this) a rectangular shape, with floor to ceiling windows stepping out onto a shared balcony with the two adjacent rooms. It looks out onto the street which is very pleasant and populated with three storey townhouses just off Baker Street around 3 minutes walk from the tube station. Very comfortable bed, very clean bathroom, TV and ironing board with tea and cofee making and all the usual hotel equipment. Towels are provided (they aren't everywhere) and the breakfast is of good but not outstanding standard. Possibly the best thing about the hotel is the location being very close to central london and right next to Marylebone High Street where there is a wide selection of bars, restaurants, shops and supermarkets. If you are staying here for any length of time I'd recommend eating at the Gunmakers Pub around the corner, the food is absolutely exceptional and very reasonably priced. But back to the hotel, it surpassed my expectations, dont get me wrong, its basic but its good basic, rather than shabby / unkempt basic! Another great addition is the free Wi-Fi - superb signal throughout my stay and I've basically been online for two days without any problems whatsoever. That's got to be worth something. People in previous reviews have complained about the noise, all I'll say is this, its London, London is a noisy city! The street is relatively quiet although you will often hear sirens, so I'd always recommend bringing earplugs. But no way is this a 'noisy hotel' . Overall rating is four star not because its of Hilton standard, but purely based on its value for money, location and cleanliness. Hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: buchends
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit small, but contain a refrig. Breakfasts are good. It's funny though when they hand you a menu and it seems like there's a choice between the ham and eggs OR the cereals and fruit. There isn't. You can help yourself to anything and everyone did, but they kept giving everyone the menu each morning! The rooms are well kept and clean and comfortable. The location is great as it is close to the Baker St. tube stop and is in the heart of the West End. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “cleaners are terrrible !!”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover060
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1night in may for a shopping trip, Check in was 1pm got there about 11.30 room wasnt ready which we were fine with as we were advised check in as 1 man let us check in early came back at 1.30/2pm he gave us key went up to the tiny room to find covers all messed on bed filty sheets, sanitary towels in bed and dirty towels all over the place. The man didnt seem very apolegetic but we were to tired to fight about it went back up when cleaners had cleaned after a half hour. While waiting another man came down same thing in his room. I never review hotels but seriously that was a 1st.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - a good place to stay in London.”
Reviews.Author: Trav369
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed one night in December. The staff was friendly and the cooked to order English breakfast was nice. The room was small but clean and with everything we needed. It was also very quiet so we had a very good sleep. The location is excellent - just next to Marylebone High street with several restaurants and shops, and not too far to walk to Oxford street.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hagbart
Reviews.Content: Nice and centrally located hotel near Baker Street tube and Oxford Street. The hotel has a friendly staff, good location and it is quiet. Really clean hotel and room, even with Norwegian eyes. The room had everything we needed; kettle, shower, bath, refrigerator (we had to plug it in), ironing facilities and a small TV. Good traditional English breakfast, but we missed some salads and vegetables for the breakfast. The traditional English breakfast is probably not too healthy in the long run. The room was a bit tiny, but OK, this is London. The bed was a bit too hard for my wife. The wireless Internet connection came and went.

Reviews.Title: “Small, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Pnill
Reviews.Content: Our room was located in the basement, in a hallway that smelled like propane. Although we went in January, the room was incredibly hot. The window could only be open if we were in the room, as it turned right onto a staircase that had an unlocked door to the street on the top. The room was really small as well. We had to pay when we checked in, the payment should be cash All the staff were friendly except one, who made fun of our English and acted like he did not understand us, even if everyone else we spoke to understood us just fine. The location was ok, not too far away from Oxford street, but still good 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisey”
Reviews.Author: lurvlyloz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the regency for one night only. The rooms were small but had everything required. the hotel is in an ideal location 5 minute walk from the tube & attractions. the only down fall was the amount of noise from out side. I think it was mainly the hotel generators and such but was very noisey. you couldn't have the windows open and the hotel didn't have any air con.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect except for Noise and Shower”
Reviews.Author: SbHokie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regency Hotel for five nights in December close to Christmas. The location is perfect! A short walk takes you to the Baker Street Underground Station, and you are then only two stops from Oxford Circus and three from Piccadilly Circus! Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum is right across the street. Approximately two or three blocks over from the hotel is a cute little shopping street with little boutiques and some nice mid-range restaurants. The included full English breakfast was delicious and made to order. I's a nice free way to start a day of sightseeing, and it was very filling. The rooms are small, but not so small as to be uncomfortable if you like the person you're staying with. Plus, my room was only used for sleeping and bathing, so size didn't matter. The room included a television, hairdryer, an ironing board and iron, and an electric tea kettle. There was no alarm clock in my room, so make sure you have one with you just in case. My only complaints are the walls are tissue paper thin, so a light sleeper like me hears everything. It didn't help when our neighbors came in intoxicated at 3am the first night there. On the plus side, the road the hotel is on is very quiet, so no outside noise to compete with. Unfortunately, the shower was worthless. I hardly felt clean the entire time due to the slow trickle coming from the shower head. On the plus side, you also have a bathtub so alternative bathing is available if you aren't in a rush. I just had trouble when it came to rinsing my long hair. I was on the top floor, so it may not be so bad closer to the ground. All in all, I would definitely consider staying here again...mainly because of the location. It was great to be so close to everything I wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located comfortable B&B hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHayes55
Reviews.Content: A well-situated B&B hotel between Baker St and Oxford St areas, with plenty of eating options locally. My room was booked as a single but was actually a small double on the first floor. Very clean and well-equipped for this kind of hotel with bath, ironing board etc, comfortable bed, clean and well looked after. There was virtually no street noise. Soundproofing from other rooms seemed poor although it was quiet from about 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: AngiJakobstad
Reviews.Content: Good location, small rooms, not familyfriendly. We were two familys with yong children that stayd at this hotel. I dont recommend this hotel for familys. Hotel located nere a hospital. Patiens from the hospital stay in this hotel and they expect all other guests to live like they are ill too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gajda
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Regency Hotel for five nights in a double room. We have really enjoyed the stay at Regency Hotel. Even though the staff didn’t speak English fluently they where able to help us if we had questions or needed help. The room was quite small but clean thus we felt comfortable. In the room there was television, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee/ tea facilities and free Wi-Fi. The bed was really good. Furthermore there was room service every day. The breakfast was good. There were different kinds of cereals, egg, bacon, backed beans, toast bread, jam, juice and coffee. The hotel is located close to Baker Street and Baker Street tube station thus there is great travel opportunities. Furthermore the hotel is located near Regent Park, Madame Tussauds, and a lot great eating places. We really enjoyed our stay at Regency Hotel and we can only recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: AScotAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Despite booking several weeks in advance I was told on arrival there were no rooms available. Fortunately I was able to arrange accommodation elsewhere but that would not be so easy in peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sundinkc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regency with a large group for five nights. Although our basement room was pretty small, all the amenities were there. A decent breakfast is provided (eggs, toast, cereal, bacon, etc.) for free. Although it came and went, free wireless internet is provided. The staff did not go out of their way but they were cordial and provided services (wake up call, calling a taxi) when asked. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and a great location”
Reviews.Author: DebbBee
Reviews.Content: Just spent six nights at the Regency in a triple room with my husband and teenaged daughter. The room was very comfortable. We had one double bed and one twin, a private bathroom, a fridge, a hair dryer, a pot to make tea, and an iron and ironing board. The hotel has free wifi, which is very convenient. The location is excellent. Although Nottingham Place is a quiet street, it is surrounded by more major streets with lots of shops and restaurants. There are several places to grab a quick sandwich (such as Pret-a-Manger, EAT, and Tesco Express), as well as banks with ATMs and a Boots on Baker Street. There is also a supermarket on Marylebone High Street. But the most important thing about the location is that the hotel is a five-minute walk from Baker Street station, which is on five different Tube lines so you can quickly get anywhere in London. And there is an internet cafe at the corner of Marylebone and Baker Street. The only real negative was the lack of furniture for storing clothes. I had to shove my clothes into a cabinet designed for a small fridge, while my daughter put her things in the night table and my husband used a desk drawer and the shelf on top of the closet. A dresser or two would have helped. The breakfast is adequate but not great. You can get eggs, bacon, sausage, mushrooms (from a can), a heated canned tomato, cereal, and toast. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, fantastic location, very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLady75
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the Regency hotel, it was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have had in a long time. The rooms were clean and nice. I really enjoyed the breakfast as well, very friendly staff. We needed to find out about some events in London and they were very eager to give us information. You can't go wrong with the location its right near the Madame Tussauds exhibit and is on Baker street which gives you access to great restaurants on Marylebone, shopping in the fashion quarter, and one of the most central locations in London. Very reasonable rates and a great experience overall. Would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to end a great trip”
Reviews.Author: RedFoxSaginaw_MI
Reviews.Content: Found my London hotel through PicturesofEngland.com although the site has other cities and more than just hotels. Then I contacted the Regency directly by email. Changed my mind several times before going with this choice. In writing this review, couldn't decide between Average and Above Average. Haven't stayed in enough hotels yet and everyone has their own preferences. The Regency is in a great location on a very quiet street only about two blocks from the Baker St. tube stop. Madame Toussard's is at the end of the street on Marylebone. I was 64 yrs old at the time, a solo traveler. Had a good breakfast. The staff was very helpful, although I had no problem with my room which was very nice. I think there's a lift. I was only there two nights and I was very busy trying to see all I could in a day and one-half; still did a lot of walking. (Strongly recommend taking a bus tour and a river tour if you're short of time.) I had to leave very early the last day to catch my plane. The front desk had arranged for a driver to take me to the airport (it may have been a luxary car). In looking for a hotel for my next trip, I haven't found one that will meet my requirements like the Regency did. I'd return but I'll be another part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChelmsfordEssex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a central London location, off a quiet street just a few minutes away from Baker Street tube station. Our room was clean and comfortable with a good size en suite bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the lady serving in the breakfast room. The full English breakfast was excellent. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: DD001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights the room was clean, staff friendly enough but lacked atmoshphere. Rooms were clean. Area peacful. Good breakfast. You could get better deal for the price

Reviews.Title: “Flea Pit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was on holiday with my girlfriend and found this hotel through an agency. When checking in, the receptionist could hardly speak English and was more interested in smoking and watching TV. The rooms were tiny and not clean at all. We had to pay in advance and were forced in staying one night, the door did not lock properly and we went to check out at 6am, but the night porter was asleep in the reception. Hotel from Hell.

HotelInfo.Name: Regency Hotel - Nottingham Place
HotelInfo.Address: 19 Nottingham Place, London W1M 3FF, England
